content:
IRootDesigner Interface

Definition

Provides support for root-level designer view technologies.

In this Article

[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
public interface IRootDesigner : IDisposable, System.ComponentModel.Design.IDesigner

Remarks

A root designer is the designer that is in the top position, or root, of the current design-time document object hierarchy. A root designer must implement the IRootDesigner interface. A root designer typically manages the background view in designer view mode, and usually displays the controls within the base container of the current design time project.

Properties

SupportedTechnologies

Gets the set of technologies that this designer can support for its display.

public System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology[] SupportedTechnologies { get; }
Value
ViewTechnology[]

An array of supported ViewTechnology values.

Remarks

The ViewTechnology enumeration indicates the supported view technologies.

Note

The System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology and System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology fields are obsolete. Use System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology for new designer implementations.

Methods

GetView(ViewTechnology)

Gets a view object for the specified view technology.

public object GetView (System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology technology);
technology
ViewTechnology

A ViewTechnology that indicates a particular view technology.

Returns
Object

An object that represents the view for this designer.

Exceptions
ArgumentException

The specified view technology is not supported or does not exist.

Remarks

This method returns a view object that can present a user interface to the user. The returned data type is an Object, because there can be a variety of different user interface technologies. Development environments typically support more than one technology.

Note

The System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology and System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology fields are obsolete. Use System.ComponentModel.Design.ViewTechnology for new designer implementations.
